snippet.title: An interview with New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio
snippet.description: Short summary of Last Wednesday afternoon, I interviewed New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio in his office at New York's City Hall. Here is a transcript of the interview, which is the basis of my Monday column on de Blasio and the city.

snippet.title: Autistic Md. boy says he wants to resume relationship with girls accused of abusing him
snippet.description: Cellphone videos furnish a chronicle of alleged assaults that authorities are using to prosecute the teens.

snippet.title: From vacations to computer puzzles, young entrepreneur helps clients organize their lives
snippet.description: A poly sci grad uses smarts and connections to build a business serving Washington's wealthy

snippet.title: Sucked into the vortex of lost rings and their miraculous rediscovery
snippet.description: David Copperfield has nothing on this amazing magic trick, 30 years in the making.

snippet.title: Braun homers twice, rallies Brewers over Pirates
snippet.description: Jason Grilli was bothered more by the single he gave up before the game-winning two-run homer.

snippet.title: 4 French journalists home after long Syrian ordeal
snippet.description: Four French journalists kidnapped and held for 10 months in Syria returned home Sunday to joyful families, a presidential welcome and questions about how France managed to obtain their freedom from Islamic extremists.

snippet.title: 'Mad Men' star Christina Hendricks talks Season 7, Joan's evolution and getting ready for the end
snippet.description: "[The men] don't know how to see someone smart and talented and powerful and also take pride in how they look," Christina says of the male characters' reaction to Joan.

snippet.title: Resilient Bulls brace for next obstacle: Wizards
snippet.description: Never mind all they overcame. The only obstacle that matters now for the Chicago Bulls is the one in front of them.

snippet.title: The taxonomy of the political book hatchet job
snippet.description: If there's a political book everyone's talking about, the real shocker is if anyone has anything nice to say at all.

snippet.title: Silver wants age limit change, no rush on others
snippet.description: Even as the NBA prepares for a draft that could be headlined by freshmen, Commissioner Adam Silver remains committed to keeping them in college.
